meanings.definition: A person with a small head or brain.
meanings.sent1: The pinhead struggled to understand the complex math problem.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the pinhead in the crowd due to his tiny head.
meanings.sent3: The pinhead tried to remember where he left his keys, but his small brain failed him.
meanings.sent4: His pinhead couldn't comprehend the depth of the philosophical discussion.
meanings.sent5: The pinhead's brain was so small, it was like a pea rolling around in his skull.

meanings.definition: A small, pointed or rounded head of a pin.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to prick your finger on the pinhead of the needle.
meanings.sent2: She examined the pinhead closely to see if it was sharp enough.
meanings.sent3: The pinhead of the thumbtack gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The pinhead of the nail was barely visible in the wooden board.
meanings.sent5: The pinhead on the sewing pin was so tiny, it was hard to thread.

meanings.sent1: He felt like a pinhead in the vast crowd of talented musicians.
meanings.sent2: She dismissed him as just another pinhead in the office.
meanings.sent3: The pinhead of a man thought he could outsmart the detective.
meanings.sent4: The CEO treated the interns like pinheads, ignoring their ideas.
meanings.sent5: The pinhead of a politician had no influence in the legislative process.
